name: Bradford Gray Telford
bio: Bradford Gray Telford was educated at Princeton and Columbia and has published work in many journals including Agni, Lyric, Diner, Eclipse, the Yale Review, Pleiades, Bloom, and Hayden’s Ferry Review. He is the recipient of the Erhardt-Cullen and Inprint-Fondren Fellowships at the University of Houston, where he is a doctoral candidate in literature and creative writing. Currently, he is translating Geneviève Huttin’s The Story of My Voice and is poetry editor of Gulf Coast: A Journal of Literature and Fine Art.
